meanings.def: a fine white or brown powder made from grain, especially wheat, and used in cooking for making bread, cakes, etc.
examples: Sift the flour and salt into a bowl.
Wholemeal flour is more nutritious than white flour.
The cake is made with equal parts of flour and sugar.
The butterflies flit from flower to flower.
Blend the flour with a little milk to make a smooth paste.
Rub the butter into the flour.

meanings.def: fine soft powder made from the seeds or roots of vegetables
to cover something with a layer of flour
examples: Roll the dough on a lightly floured surface.
